meanings.definition: Unable to be cured or healed.
meanings.sent1: The doctor sadly informed us that her illness was incurable.
meanings.sent2: The incurable disease left him feeling hopeless.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, the stubborn stain on his shirt seemed incurable.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like an incurable addiction, impossible to shake off.
meanings.sent5: The incurable nature of his condition weighed heavily on his mind.

meanings.definition: Not able to be remedied or corrected.
meanings.sent1: The incurable mistake in the report led to serious consequences.
meanings.sent2: His incurable habit of procrastination always caused him trouble.
meanings.sent3: The incurable leak in the roof made every rainy day an adventure indoors.
meanings.sent4: The divide between them felt like an incurable rift, growing wider each day.
meanings.sent5: The incurable error in the code crashed the entire system unexpectedly.
